children.name: suddenly
children.definition: /ˈsʌdnli/  if something happenssuddenly, it happens quickly when you are not expecting it:đột nhiên, chợt
examples: Suddenly there was a loud bang and all the lights went out.
Suddenly, the eagle opened its wings.

children.name: suddenly realize
examples: Isuddenly realizedthat there was someone following me.
George died very suddenly.

children.name: die suddenlydie unexpectedly
examples: Several years ago her husband died suddenly at the age of 64.

children.name: all of a sudden
children.definition: suddenly - use this especially in stories or descriptions of past events:đột nhiên, đột ngột
examples: We waited and waited, then all of a sudden we saw a sail on the horizon.
The way he decided to leave all of a sudden didn’t make any sense.
It seemed to happen all of a sudden-I felt dizzy and I just collapsed.
All of a sudden, he takes a gun out of his pocket and shoots.
He just all of a sudden decided to leave.

children.name: out of the blue
children.definition: suddenly and unexpectedly – used especially when you hear from someone you have not seen for a long time or when someone tells you something that surprises you :đột nhiên, thật bất ngờ
examples: She told me, out of the blue, that she was going to live in New York.

children.name: completely out of the blue
examples: Do you remember Jane? Well, she phoned me yesterday, completely out of the blue.

children.name: out of the blue
examples: She turned up on my doorstep, out of the blue.
The offer had come completely out of the blue.

children.name: abruptly
children.definition: if sth ends or if sb moves or speaksabruptly,they do it suddenly and unexpectedly:đột ngột
examples: ▪ The party was stopped abruptly when the police turned up.
▪ She turned abruptly and went back inside.
▪ ‘You may leave now,’ he said, abruptly.

children.name: on the spur of the moment
children.definition: informal if you do sthon the spur of the moment,you suddenly decide to do sth that you had not planned to do:ngẫu hứng
examples: I bought the car on the spur of the moment.
On the spur of the moment, we decided to head north that day instead of East.
We just jumped in a caron thespur of the moment and drove to the seaside.

children.name: from nowhere
children.definition: from/ out of nowhere happening or appearing suddenly and without warning, so that you are surprised or shocked: đột ngột, đột nhiên
examples: In the last few seconds, Gunnell came from nowhere to win another gold medal.
She said her attacker seemed tocomeout of nowhere.

children.name: from out of nowhere
examples: From out of nowhere he asks me to marry him!
I was doing 80 miles per hour when from out of nowhere this cop on a motorcycle pulled me over.

children.name: at short notice
children.definition: /ət ˌʃɔːʳt ˈnəʊts/  if something happens at short notice, it happens suddenly without you having time to prepare for it:
examples: đột xuất, không báo trước
▪ Both players pulled out of the competition yesterday at short notice.
Cả hai người chơi rút khỏi cuộc thi ngày hôm qua không báo trước.
▪ Occasionally, tours may have to be cancelled at short notice.
Thỉnh thoảng, các tour du lịch có thể phải hủy bỏ đột xuất.
at short noticeUK(USon short notice)
only a short time before something happens
_I can't cancel my arrangements at such short notice.

children.name: without warning
children.definition: suddenly and with no signs that it was going to happen – used about bad or dangerous things:không hề báo trước
examples: Without warning, tears began to roll down his cheeks.
At five to four Greg went into convulsions. It happened suddenly and without warning.
One day, he collapsed without warning.
Then, without warning, her husband left her.

children.name: sudden
children.definition: happening, coming, or done quickly or when you do not expect it :đột nhiên, bất ngờ, đột ngột
examples: I felt a sudden sharp pain in my stomach.
Rebecca’s decision to leave was very sudden.
Depression is sometimes brought on by a sudden change in your life.

children.name: asudden changein the weather
examples: Life is cruel, she thought, with asudden rush ofanger.

children.name: asudden movement
examples: Her death was sudden.

children.name: dramatic
children.definition: happening suddenly, and making a situation either much better or much worse:đột ngột
examples: There has been a dramatic increase in homelessness over the past few years.
the dramatic changes that took place in Eastern Europe
dramatically[adv] B2 đáng kể
Oil reserves have fallen dramatically since the war broke out.
Output has increased dramatically.

children.name: a dramatic change
examples: The Internet has brought dramatic changes to the way we work.

children.name: a dramatic increase/rise
examples: There has been a dramatic rise in fuel costs.

children.name: a dramatic fall/drop/decline
examples: Between these years there was a dramatic fall in youth employment.

children.name: a dramatic effect/impact
examples: An accident can have a dramatic effect on your family’s finances.

children.name: a dramatic improvement
examples: There has been a dramatic improvement in the standard of students’ work.

children.name: a dramatic shift
children.definition: change in the way people think or do something
examples: This announcement signalled a dramatic shift in the government’s policy.

children.name: a dramatic result
examples: Cameras on the streets have produced dramatic results in reducing crime.

children.name: a dramatic difference
examples: The programs made a dramatic difference to the lives of millions of people.

children.name: abrupt
children.definition: sudden, unexpected, and often unwanted:đột ngột
examples: His departure was abrupt and completely unexpected.
abrupt end/departure/change etc
anabrupt changeof plan
The police brought the demonstration to an abrupt end.
There has been an abrupt shift in the government thinking regarding these issues.
come to an abrupt end/halt etc
The bus came to an abrupt halt.

children.name: snap
children.definition: snap decision/judgementa decision or judgement that is made very suddenly, often without thinking about it enough: thình lình, chớp nhoáng
examples: Snap decisions are not always the best decisions.
Usually she did not make snap judgements about people.
He always makes snap decisions and never thinks about their consequences.

children.name: unexpected
children.definition: sth that is unexpected surprises you because you did not expect it:
examples: There have been unexpected delays on the freeway because of an accident.
The experiment produced some unexpected results.
Hague’s announcement wasnot entirely unexpected.
Well, fancy seeing you here! This really is an unexpectedpleasure!
unexpectedly[adv]
Dunbar died unexpectedly of a stroke on Thursday.
His father died unexpectedly.

children.name: completely/totally unexpected
examples: Bobby’s decision to leave the band was totally unexpected.
Her death wastotally unexpected.

children.name: unforeseen
children.definition: an unforeseen situation is one that you did not expect to happen, and which usually cause you difficulty: không biết trước, không dự kiến
examples: unforeseen circumstances/events/changes etc
Due to unforeseen circumstances, the play has been cancelled.
Due to unforeseencircumstancesthe cost of the improvements has risen by twenty per cent.
Once you have started the training you will not be allowed to leave, unless unforeseen circumstances arise.
unforeseen problems/difficulties/delays
unforeseen delays in supplying the equipment
Unless there are any unforeseen problems the whole project should be finished by the spring.
We had to cancel our visit to Egypt because of unforeseen problems.

children.name: be a surprise
children.definition: /come as a surprise if sth that happens is a surprise or comes as a surprise, you did not expect it to happen, and so you are surprised by it:
examples: Winning the award was a total surprise.

children.name: be a surprise/come as a surprise to
examples: Fazio’s announcement came as a surprise to most political observers.

children.name: the last person you would expect U
children.definition: the last person/thing/place (that) you would expectinformalone that you did not expect, so that you are very surprised:

children.name: Mary’s the last person you’d expect to be stopped for drunk driving
examples: It’s such a quiet little village - it’s the last place you’d expect something like this to happen.

children.name: catch sb off guard
children.definition: /catch sb unawares to happen or do sth when sb is not expecting it and not ready to deal with it:
examples: I was caught unawares by the hug and the kiss he gave me.
Her rude comments really caught me off guard.

children.name: contrary to expectations
children.definition: formal if sth happens contrary to expectations, it is the opposite of what people expected to happen: ngược với dự tính, mong đợi
examples: Contrary to expectations, the play was a big success.

children.name: contrary to sb’s expectations
examples: Michael won the competition, contrary to everyone’s expectations.

children.name: unannounced
children.definition: happening without anyone expecting or knowing about it : bất ngờ, không báo trước, nói trước
examples: Investigators from the health department made unannounced visits to the hospital in March.

children.name: arrive unannounced/show up unannounced
examples: My brother is famous for showing up at our houses unannounced, usually around dinner time.

children.name: in your wildest dreams
children.definition: if sth happens that you did not expect in your wildest dreams, it is sogoodthat you never thought that there was any possibility that it could happen: ngoài cả mong đợi, quá sức tưởng tượng
examples: In our wildest dreams, we could not have expected how successful this program would be.

children.name: never in sb’s wildest dreams
examples: Never in her wildest dreams had she imagined she would win the gold medal.

children.name: more than you bargained for
children.definition: more than you (had) bargained for if you get more than you had bargained for, you have more problems or difficulties while doing sth than you had expected or prepared for: ngoài dự tính, vượt quá dự tính
examples: Their summer vacation turned out to be much more expensive than they’d bargained for.
We got more than we bargained for when we bought the house. There’s so much work to be done!

children.name: when you do or say sth without thinking
without thinking
children.definition: /wɪðˌaʊt ˈθɪŋkɪŋ/
examples: Không nghĩ
▪ Without thinking, Charlotte hugged the girl to try to comfort her.
Không suy nghĩ, Charlotte ôm cô gái để an ủi cô.
without thinking about
Không nghĩ gì về
▪ Most US companies are still spewing out carbon dioxide without thinking about its potential costs.
Hầu hết các công ty Hoa Kỳ vẫn thải ra khí các-bon mà không cần suy nghĩ về các chi phí tiềm năng.

children.name: off the top of your head
children.definition: /ɒf ðə ˌtɒp əv jɔːʳ ˈhedǁ-ˌtɑːp-/  spoken if you give an answer off the top of your head, you say it without thinking about it for very long and without being sure it is correct:
examples: Nói ngay không cần nghĩ
▪ ‘How much is the house worth?’ ‘Off the top of my head, I’d say it’s worth maybe $160,000.’
"Giá trị của ngôi nhà là bao nhiêu?" "Không cần nghĩ, tôi có thể nói nó có giá trị khoảng 160.000 đô la".

children.name: in the heat of the moment
children.definition: /ɪn ðə ˌhiːt əv ðə ˈməʊmənt/  if you say or do something in the heat of the moment, you do it very suddenly and without thinking when you are feeling angry or excited, so that you feel sorry about it afterwards:

children.name: Trong lúc giận dữ
examples: ▪ ‘In the heat of the moment, my emotions took over and I hit him,’ Harper admitted.
"Trong lúc giận dữ, cảm xúc của tôi đã mất khống chế và tôi đánh anh ta," Harper thừa nhận.
▪ Our children need to know not only how to prevent pregnancies, but also the long-term effects of a decision they make in the heat of the moment.
Trẻ em của chúng ta cần biết không chỉ làm thế nào để ngăn ngừa mang thai, mà còn ảnh hưởng lâu dài của một quyết định mà họ thực hiện trong lúc nóng giận.

children.name: automatic
children.definition: /ˌɔːtəˈmætɪk◂/  an automatic response, reaction, or answer is one that happens immediately and without you having to think, especially because you have done it many times before:
examples: Tự động
▪ A teacher’s automatic reaction is to correct mistakes in language.
Phản ứng tự động của giáo viên là sửa lỗi bằng ngôn ngữ.
▪ Elizabeth immediately flew into a rage - her automatic response to any kind of criticism.
Elizabeth ngay lập tức bay vào cơn thịnh nộ - phản ứng tự động của cô đối với bất kỳ lời phê bình nào.
automaticadjectiveNOT CONSCIOUS tự động
done without thinking about it
_Over time, driving just becomes automatic.
_My automatic response was to pull my hand away.

children.name: automatically
children.definition: /ˌɔːtəˈmætɪkli/  if you do something automatically, you do it as a natural reaction and without thinking, because it is what you always do:
examples: Một cách tự động
▪ His mother continued to talk angrily, and Tim’s thoughts automatically switched to more pleasant subjects.
Mẹ của ông tiếp tục nói chuyện giận dữ, và suy nghĩ của Tim tự động chuyển sang những chủ đề dễ chịu hơn.
▪ You cannot automatically assume that everything your teacher says is correct.
Bạn không thể tự động cho rằng tất cả mọi thứ mà giáo viên của bạn nói là đúng.
automaticallyadverbNOT CONSCIOUS tự động
If you do something automatically, you do it without thinking about it
_I automatically put my hand out to catch it.

children.name: reflex
children.definition: /ˈriːfleks/  a reflex action, response, or movement is a physical movement that you make as a natural reaction to something, without having to think about doing it:
examples: Phản xạ
▪ a reflex eye movement
Một phản ứng phản xạ mắt
▪ At birth, an infant can perform only simple reflex actions and behaviours.
Khi sinh ra, trẻ sơ sinh chỉ có thể thực hiện các hành động và hành vi phản xạ đơn giản.

children.name: knee-jerk reaction
children.definition: /ˈniː dʒɜːʳk riˌækʃən/  a reaction that someone makes without thinking at all, because it is the way they always react - use this about a reaction that you expect and disapprove of:

children.name: Phản ứng tự động
examples: ▪ Their knee-jerk reaction is to object to everything the management suggests.
Phản ứng tự động của họ là phản đối mọi thứ mà ban giám đốc đề xuất.

children.name: ▪ If a journalist’s judgement is questioned, the knee-jerk reaction is usually, ‘I have a right to print whatever I want, so I will.’
examples: Nếu câu hỏi của phóng viên bị thẩm vấn, phản ứng tự động thường là 'Tôi có quyền in bất cứ thứ gì tôi muốn, vì vậy tôi sẽ'.

children.name: off-the-cuff
children.definition: /ˌɒf ðə ˈkʌf/  an off-the-cuff remark is one that you make without thinking carefully and without any preparation:
examples: Không chuẩn bị trước
▪ The press officer said that the president’s statement was an off-the-cuff remark, not as an official statement of policy.
Viên chức báo chí nói rằng tuyên bố của tổng thống chỉ là một nhận xét không chuẩn bị trước, chứ không phải là tuyên bố chính thức.
off the cuff[adverb]
Một cách không chuẩn bị trước
▪ Speaking off the cuff and with emotion, Pope John Paul II described his disappointment with the recent course of Western history.
Phát biểu mà không có chuẩn bị trước và cảm xúc, Đức Gioan Phaolô II mô tả sự thất vọng của ông trong lịch sử Tây phương gần đây.

children.name: sharp
children.definition: adjectiveSUDDEN thình lình, đột ngột
examples: happening suddenly, quickly and strongly
_a sharp drop in temperature
_a sharp decline in the standard of living
_a sharprise/increasein the number of cases of this illness
_a sharpbendin the road
_to suffer a sharpblowto the head

children.name: sharply
children.definition: adverbSUDDENL thình lình, đột ngột

children.name: quickly and suddenly
examples: _Inflation hasrisen/fallensharply.
_His healthimproved/deterioratedsharply this week.
_The road bends sharply to the left.

children.name: sharp
children.definition: adverbSUDDENLY
examples: thình lình, đột ngột
suddenly or immediately
_After the church, turn sharpleft/right.

children.name: all at once
children.definition: thình lình, đột nhiên

children.name: suddenly and unexpectedly
examples: _All at once there was a loud crashing sound.

children.name: overnight
children.definition: adjective,adverbSUDDENLY bất ngờ

children.name: suddenly and unexpectedly
examples: _She became a star overnight.
_The book was an overnight success.

children.name: against (all) the odds/against all odds
children.definition: chống đối mạnh mẽ

children.name: If you do or achieve something against (all) the odds/against all odds, you do or achieveit although there were a lot of problems and you were not likely to succeed
examples: _Against all the odds, he recovered.
